file_content.text: My master, your followers have gathered to meet you in your moment of victory.
Behold the heir of Tulak Hord and Kallig. Bow!
My lord, let me be as the lightsaber at your side. Always at your disposal.
My lord, I am most honored and humbled to serve.
We must finish our mission--drive the Republic from the galaxy and take back what is rightfully ours!
Go and defeat the Republic.
I find war dull compared to the intrigues of a good murder. I'll be sure to delegate to more engaged commanders.
The Republic will tremble before us.
Purge this pyramid of any who are still loyal to Thanaton. They are traitors.
Kill Thanaton's supporters.
I am well-acquainted with his allies. It will be done.
My lord, wouldn't we be better served if--I mean, of course, my lord. I will obey.
We are the guardians of ancient Sith knowledge, the source of Sith power. Find artifacts, learn secret rituals and bring them to me.
I want knowledge and power!
Of course. Thanaton had very promising projects underway, my lord. I will see if any have borne fruit and report back to you.
I will redouble the efforts being put into the excavation of the Korriban tombs.
You've done well for yourself, little snake.
But we're done. Your enemy is dead. Free us.
But we're done. Your enemy is dead. Free us as you promised.
Speak for yourself, Ergast. I, for one, have no desire to be bound to a coffin in the frozen wastes of Hoth once more. Alone and forgotten.
Is there a way I can help you find peace before you go?
What keeps you from death?
Perhaps. The Jedi are known to redeem ghosts to freedom. But it goes against everything that being Sith stands for.
Let my light redeem you.
Then go, find peace.
Unbelievable. I never thought I'd feel like this.
Is this what it's like to truly die?
What is it?
Freedom.
None of you deserve redemption. Go.
Just leave then.
No, you are too dark. You are doomed to our same fate and therefore cannot save us.
Go, be free. I'm sorry I can't do more.
Then leave me.
On second thought, I think I'd rather have you around.
Maybe I'll keep you.
Seems like you'll just have to stay with me forever.
I guess you're stuck then.
I never wanted this to be a permanent arrangement. Go, all of you.
You're all free.
A brave fool. A very brave fool.
Thank you, my lord.
Goodbye, little snake.
No. I will not go back to Hoth. Not since I lived have I felt as free.
Then stay here forever. I admit I've grown used to the power.
I'm keeping you.
Haha. Don't you remember the binding promise you made? The blood you shed? You have no hold of me.
You made a binding promise, I'm afraid. You shed blood! You can't keep me!
Or me either, little snake.
You think you're clever, little snake. Don't you know you can't break a promise sealed with blood? I'm not going anywhere!
Or me.
Fool. Not since I've died have I been as free. If you wish to keep me, that's fine by me.
Curse you. We will find our revenge. We will find our freedom! Aggghhh!
To think that you'd be a Dark Council member before me. It makes me sick.
What will you do with all your newfound authority I wonder?
Away, woman. I am my master's true servant. Speak, my lord, and I will follow.
Where next?
My lord, where do we go now?
My lord, this is incredible. I am truly humbled if I was even the slightest help. Where to now?
So now that you got the Sith eating out of your pocket, where to next?
Thanaton is dead and with him, the old Sith ways.
To take over the Empire.
I am the future of the Sith Order, and I intend to reshape it in my image. The Empire and the Sith belong to me.
The Republic still fights. We must crush them, hound them across the galaxy until they are forced to leave our people in peace.
To defend our people.
We must ensure that they never again drive the Sith Empire from the galaxy.
This galaxy is full of powerful, mystical secrets... dangerous and dark.
To find more power.
I'm going to learn those secrets and feast on their power, until no one dares oppose me.
Bow to the new Dark Lord of the Sith!
Behold the heir of Tulak Hord and Kallig. Bow to Darth Nox!
Behold the heir of Tulak Hord and Kallig. Bow to Darth Occlus!
Behold the heir of Tulak Hord and Kallig. Bow to Darth Imperius!
Zash and I have been looking over the information you recovered from Thanaton's library.
Any truth to the rumors that there's a big old Republic prison on Belsavis?
I heard something of that from Master Ryen, but I didn't want to believe it.
Unfortunately, Belsavis looks like the most promising lead. Darth Iratus went there seeking a cure for the deterioration of his body.
It sounds like precisely the thing you need.
Then let's set a course for Belsavis.
Belsavis it is, then.
I want to keep all options open. Continue to research Voss while I go to Belsavis.
Don't rule out Voss.
Yes, my lord.
I hope you can tell me more than that. I don't like going in blind.
I need more information.
My knowledge is limited, but I'll brief you once we dock with the Belsavis space station.
I found some things that look relevant.
Excellent. It will take some time for Ashara and I to study these.
In the meantime, you may want to check in on Harkun. Make certain he knows you're alive, and that he shouldn't take any liberties with the trials.
Harkun knows better than to cross me.
I trust him.
He knew better than to cross me, too, but that didn't stop him from trying.
I would like very much to know how my future apprentice is coming along.
That's a good idea.
I'll let you know the moment I find anything.
I know better than to trust my apprentice with you.
Stay away from Ashara.
Don't worry. Your little Jedi girl is smart. She keeps me at better than arm's length.
It makes no sense. Darth Vilus produced over three thousand volumes--writings and holocrons. Makes a one-line notation: "Am hearing voices, must find cure."
Then nothing! In three thousand volumes, not a single other mention of the subject!
Do you think Thanaton could have tampered with your resources?
Suspicious.
These are common diaries, not Sith secrets. There's no reason anyone would--no, you're right.
Surely there must be other leads.
Isn't there anything else?
Even among Sith, ghostly voices and power overloads are not common occurrences. I've looked every--wait.
Being in that Dashade body hasn't done much for your research abilities.
You're useless.
These fingers aren't as nimble for turning pages, but I assure you, I can do just fine--wait.
Why didn't I see this before? Volume 2,397, line 232: "Killed my fourth apprentice today. Caught him spying."
Same line, volume 2,455: "Killed my fourth apprentice today. Caught him spying." The entire volume's a duplicate!
At least we know what we're looking for.
That's a start.
What happened to the other volume?
So where's the missing entry?
How did that fool know what volume to hide?
Thanaton.
Thanaton must have grasped what was going on when he confronted you and ordered the volumes switched. Let's hope he didn't destroy them.
He keeps a private, heavily guarded library under Dromund Kaas. I'm not supposed to know about it, but for various reasons, I do.
I'm guessing Darth Vilus's missing volume, and another by Darth Iratus, are there. Both could be imperative to your survival.
Smart move, Sith. Thanaton may hate you, but the rest of the Empire will be hard-pressed to throw stones when you walk by.
Yes, I only wish my time had been half as productive.
We will serve the Empire.
